title: Remote access scams (AnyDesk/TeamViewer ‘tech support’)
summary: Remote access scammers convince you to install software so they can control your device and access accounts.
how_it_works: You receive an unexpected call claiming there’s a problem with your device or account.
They tell you to install remote access/screen-sharing software (e.g., AnyDesk/TeamViewer).
Once connected, they try to access banking, email, or payments and steal money/info.
warning_signs: Unexpected call offering to ‘fix’ your computer/phone.
They insist you install remote access software.
They ask you to log in to banking while they watch/control your screen.
example_hooks: “We’re from your bank/ISP — download this app so we can help.”
“There’s malware on your device; we need remote access right now.”
what_to_do: Never install remote access software because a stranger asked.
If you already did: disconnect internet, uninstall the app, change passwords, and contact your bank.
Use official support channels you initiate yourself.

quick_quiz.q: What’s the safest way to get to the real website?
choices: Click the link in the message
Type the website address yourself or use the official app
Reply and ask them for another link
quick_quiz.explain: Scam messages often include links to fake sites. Typing the address yourself (or using the official app) reduces that risk.

quick_quiz.q: A message says you must act 'within 24 hours' or you'll lose access. What should you do first?
choices: Stop and verify using official contact details you find yourself
Forward it to friends to ask
quick_quiz.explain: Urgency is a classic pressure tactic. Verify using trusted contact details.
